forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 49. South wind around 3 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. North northwest wind 3 to 9 mph.

weather_report:
In the early hours of this chilly January morning, Downtown San Francisco wears a soft, cloudy veil, muted by the lingering embrace of the marine layer. The air is crisp, with a chill whispering of the lower temperatures that promise to settle around 49 degrees overnight. As the day beckons, the clouds will part ever so slightly, allowing for patches of sunlight to filter through. By afternoon, the temperature will dip a bit further to a cool 55 degrees, with a gentle breeze from the north-northwest reminding everyone that the Pacific is never far away.

The fog that dances along the horizon adds a touch of mystique to the city—especially near the Golden Gate, where the suggestion of morning mist mingles with the skyline. It’s best to dress warmly; think layers that can transition from the coolness of early morning to the slightly warmer afternoons. A light jacket would serve well, paired with a cozy scarf to wrap around you as you meander through the quiet streets. For the brave of heart, a walk along the waterfront or through the fog-kissed parks offers a chance to savor the tranquility before the day truly unfurls. The lure of a good café for a steaming cup of coffee calls to those seeking a quieter start, evoking a sense of peace that can only be found in such weather—a perfect backdrop for contemplative blues or a casual stroll with friends amidst the unique beauty of the city.
